title: Oya, Raebareli
text:
Oya is a village in <a href="Amawan">Amawan</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. As of 2011, its population is 1,635, in 309 households. It has one primary school and no healthcare facilities.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Oya as comprising 5 hamlets, with a total population of 592 people (300 male and 292 female), in 120 households and 105 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 739 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Oya as having a population of 807 people, in 145 households, and having an area of 276.81 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
